title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 7 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: appeal for witnesses after man found dead in st austell .
ship captain 'five times over legal alcohol limit ' .
two people arrested after man suffers 'life-threatening head injuries ' .
'significant marine life found near quarrying site ' off the lizard .
arrests of children drop in devon .
sus car fire damages two vehicles in torquay overnight .
disruption to south west trains because of waterloo works .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: tom daley shares honeymoon photo
text: the couple got married three months ago but have only now found time for their honeymoon .

documents.title: the lizard quarrying sea transport plans 'still being investigated despite reef report '
text: developers who want to quarry stone near a cornwall reef say options for sea transport are `` still being investigated '' despite claims new evidence shows significant species of marine life off the lizard .
the owners of dean quarry want to supply rock to the uk 's emerging tidal lagoon industry and said the only viable way of transporting it was by boat .
but a new report published for the marine conservation society said the reef area - the manacles - should be left undisturbed .
a volunteer diver organisation , called seasearch , also said it had found signs of a range of important marine life .

in response to the report , the company said : `` options for sea transport are still being investigated so we believe this report is premature and is based on draft proposals from two and half years ago which are no longer under consideration .
`` any significant new sea transport infrastructure would require a planning application and marine licence application , including a full impact assessment . ''
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: causing a stink : smelly flower 's pollen put on ice after early bloom
text: rare pollen from a plant at paignton zoo has been sent 500 miles up to scotland - but arrived too late to be put to use .
the pollen was from a titan arum , which the zoo said is one of the largest and , when in bloom , one of the smelliest plants on earth , hence it being known as the corpse plant .

the plant 's huge flowers only bloom once every few years and the pollen was sent to the royal botantical gardens in edinburgh to pollinate their own titan , but the plant took experts by surprise and bloomed early .
the pollen from paignton will now be stored there at -80c ( -112f ) , meaning it could last for years .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: germans who flock to south west confused over difference between devon and cornwall
text: it seems that german tourists , who flock to the south west in their thousands every year , think the county of devon is just part of cornwall .
author: The Daily Telegraph

documents.title: blood donors may have to travel to new locations
text: blood donors in the south west may have to travel to different locations to give blood following a review of sessions in the plymouth area .
the nhs blood and transplant service said it expected to start a review of sessions around the city later this year .
it confirmed it may reduce the number it held and could also ask some donors to donate at alternative venues .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: evening weather : staying cloudy with rain
text: cloud will persist through the night , with further showery rain , which may turn heavy at times .
but temperatures will be holding up as a result .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
tuesday will be a rather cloudy and cool day , with heavy showers or longer spells of rain , particularly across central parts .
however , some brief brighter interludes are also possible .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: runner jo pavey get 10,000m bronze medal - 10 years after race
text: devon 's jo pavey has finally received a 10,000m bronze medal - 10 years after she was unfairly denied it at the 2007 world championships in japan .
she finished the race fourth , but has now been upgraded to third because of a rival 's doping conviction .
turkey 's elvan abeylegesse had her result chalked off .
the 43-year-old was beaten to bronze at the time by american kara goucher , who has been upgraded to silver .
the achievement was recognised on sunday night at this year 's world championships in london .
it is pavey 's first global medal having won commonwealth and european medals .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: thugs jailed for nose bite attack at christmas party
text: a drug debt enforcer and his hired thug have been jailed for an attack on a father whose nose was bitten off at a christmas party .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: 'fun house sun house ' marks 70 years of listed buildings
text: a building in cornwall is among several that have been given listed status as historic england marks 70 years of the practice .
listing was introduced in the town and county planning act in 1947 in order to save important buildings from over-zealous post-war builders .
built between 1973 and 1974 as a holiday home in the trees , pillwood house in truro was described by architect john miller as a `` fun house as well as a sun house '' .
historic england praised the way its large windows `` allow light to flood in and give wide views of the surrounding wood '' .

`` miller made early use of glass-reinforced plastic , or fibreglass , to make the walls , which are lightweight but strong , and the steel frame was painted bright green to give it a visual connection with the surrounding trees , '' the organisation said .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: three historic trails to be created for mayflower 2020 commemorations
text: they will be part of a national network and are part of changes in plymouth being done in a bid to bring the story to life .
the mayflower national trail will connect 11 destinations across britain to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the mayflower journey .
council leader ian bowyer has approved £ 3.5m of capital funding for start of the project .

we are planning a year-long cultural programme including major events , but these projects are about improving areas so that plymouth people , as well as visitors , can enjoy them for many years to come.the immediate impact of these projects during 2020 is estimated to be in the region of an additional 500,000 visitors , creating an additional economic impact of at least £ 18 million and 360 jobs . ''
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: seaside town decline 'an epidemic ' - bankruptcy study firm
text: torquay and plymouth are personal bankruptcy hotspots in what is seen `` an epidemic '' in seaside towns and cities .
in a new study by accountants moore stephens , torquay ( was top in britain for such bankruptcies , with 43 insolvencies per 10,000 residents , compared with a british average of just under 20 .
plymouth was also in the top 10 at 35 insolvencies per 10,000 people .

the report said problems included tourist areas often lacking the economic diversity of bigger cities , as well as many local entrepreneurs and educated young people leaving traditional holiday destinations and moving to areas such as london ,
moore stephens spokesman jeremy willmont said : `` bankruptcy in the more rundown of the british seaside towns has become an epidemic .
`` as seaside tourism declines , there is less chance for these areas to reinvent their image as exciting , vibrant places for business to thrive . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: appeal after serious sexual assault on woman , 30 , in exeter city centre alley
text: a woman was sexually assaulted in a small exeter city centre alley in the early hours of sunday morning .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: father dropped baby who died from head injuries
text: a one-month-old baby died after `` flying '' out of the arms of his father when he tripped over a moses basket , an inquest has heard .
cooper eddie johnson-hicks died on 26 june 2016 at the royal cornwall hospital .
his father tristan hicks was found dead on 23 july 2016 and an inquest concluded he had taken his own life .
the inquest in truro has been hearing evidence given by mr hicks to police following his son 's death .
mr hicks told officers his mother had brought his son to him at home at polgrean place in st blazey on the morning of 26 june after she looked him .
he said he was holding cooper in the crook of his right arm while carrying a bottle of milk in his left hand .
the incident happened as he `` rushed '' into the living room of their flat .
he said : `` i was n't holding him properly .
i came rushing in , tripped over and he came flying out onto the floor . ''
cooper was initially fine , but `` went all weird '' two or three hours afterwards , he said .
after attempts at resuscitation by neighbours , cooper was taken to hospital by paramedics where he died from serious head injuries .
the post-mortem examination found he also had fractured ribs .
the inquest in truro is scheduled to last for three days .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon drunken sailor convicted in new zealand
text: authorities in new zealand say the conviction of a drunken sailor from devon should act as a warning to others on their waters .
anthony baker , 53 , was five times over the legal alcohol limit while berthing his 40,000-tonne cargo ship shansi on friday .
local pilots helping him at marsden point near auckland raised concern that he `` smelled of alcohol '' and he was arrested .
he admitted breaching new zealand 's maritime law in court today and was fined 3,000 new zealand dollars ( us $ 2,222 ; £ 1,692 ) as well as being suspended by his employer .
author: Amy Gladwell, BBC News Online

documents.title: 'tombstoning can kill ' : police urge people not to jump off rocks
text: a new campaign has been launched to try and stop people tombstoning in plymouth .
one man died from jumping from rocks into the sea in the city in 2016 and many more have received serious injuries .
police have seen an increase in calls regarding groups of people tombstoning in the waterfront areas of the city .
we are working in partnership to tackle these issues , educate those individuals on the dangers and reduce the demand on the police and health staff .

dickon berriman from the rnli said : conditions can change quickly and anyone considering jumping into the sea from height should always check for hazards in the water like submerged rocks and know where the best access out of the water is .
it 's really important that people think about the possible dangers .
people should never jump while under the influence of alcohol , drugs or peer pressure .
coasteering with a registered company may be a safer alternative . ''
in recent years plymouth has seen tragedy as a result of what some consider a fun activity .
this includes the death of a man last year as he hit the rocks jumping from the hoe foreshore and other tragic incidents where many people have been seriously injured .

in august 2016 a 17-year-old received life-changing injuries and last year a 14-year-old was described as being lucky to be alive following diving headfirst on to rocks and being rescued by the coastguard .

documents.title: escaped python explored vents and plumbing in flats
text: a snake that escaped from a flat in exeter has been found and returned to his owner .
the 14ft ( 4.3m ) african rock python got into the vents and plumbing in a block of flats in the hill barton area of the city .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service used small cameras to find the reptile .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: 'park considerately ' plea from fire crews
text: firefighters in cornwall are asking people to park their cars more considerately after they were delayed getting to a vehicle fire in lostwithiel .
a crew was called to a suspected arson attack at bodmin hill at about 01:20 .
the town 's fire station said on facebook said the crew was `` delayed due to some unthoughtful parking which caused us a problem to pass '' .
it added : `` when parking your vehicle , please consider the likes of fire appliances who may require access . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: adam fenton : newquay cancer survivor 'fell to his death '
text: a man from cornwall is thought to have fallen to his death on his first night out to celebrate being `` clear '' from cancer .
thirty-two-year-old father-of-two adam fenton , from newquay , was found on towan beach on 28 july .
he was celebrating initial reports of his recovery after six months of chemotherapy to treat blood cancer .
police said the death was being treated as unexplained and inquiries were continuing .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: hms queen elizabeth : home port arrival date set
text: the royal navy 's new £ 3bn aircraft carrier is expected to arrive in its home port within weeks , the defence secretary has confirmed .
hms queen elizabeth is due to sail into portsmouth following extensive preparations at the naval base .
the exact date is weather-dependent but is expected to be no later than 22 august .
the 65,000-tonne ship has been undergoing sea trials since setting sail from rosyth dockyard in june .
its crew currently includes personnel based in the south west , including cornwall 's rnas culdrose .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: football : peterborough united 2-1 plymouth argyle
text: newly promoted plymouth made a losing return to league one as they suffered defeat at peterborough united at the weekend .

the pilgrims fell behind just four minutes into their opening fixture of the season when a leo da silva lopes cross took a wicked deflection off gary sawyer - who was credited with an own goal - and flummoxed goalkeeper luke mccormick .
plymouth conceded again two minutes into the second period as their appeals for a foul were ignored after posh debutant jack marriott robbed defender sonny bradley .
marriott then laid a second goal on a plate for junior morias .
terrific saves from mccormick kept derek adams ' side in the contest as he denied doughty and marriott before plymouth halved their arrears .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: did you see this otterly adorable face ?
text: @ twitterid supporter alan orr had this amazing close encounter with an otter on the river torridge # devon at the weekend .
hi .
andrew from the bbc here .
can we feature your otter tweet in our local live feed , pls ?
we 'll give alan a credit for his many thanks
yes , with credit , no problem .
thanks for sharing .
still waiting to see an otter in the wild- do you have any tips ?
depends where you live but river otter in east devon is well named !
lots of sightings there .
dawn dusk best
cute little fuzzy with a lovely smile beautiful creatures

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: torquay and plymouth 'personal bankruptcy hotspots '
text: torquay and plymouth are personal bankruptcy hotspots in britain , according to a new study .
seaside towns and cities dominate the list by accountancy firm moore stephens , which said its research showed that coastal industries and tourism had continued to decline .
it added that seaside tourist areas often lacked the economic diversity of bigger cities and were too reliant on low-spending domestic tourists for employment .
the top spot was torquay ( top ) , with 43 insolvencies per 10,000 residents , compared with a national average of just under 20 .
plymouth ( above ) was also in the top 10 at 35 insolvencies per 10,000 people .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: car and lorry crash on a361
text: one person has been freed from a car after it was in a collision with a lorry on the a361 in devon , firefighters say .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service said two fire crews were called to the scene on the southbound lane between borners bridge and bish mill at about 11:20 .
it said : `` the casualty was successfully released by crews using hydraulic rescue equipment , a scoop stretcher and small tools '' .
they were then taken to hospital by ambulance .
their condition is not known .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: drunken sailor fined and suspended
text: a devon captain who was five times over the legal alcohol limit while berthing his cargo ship in new zealand has been fined and suspended .
anthony baker , 53 , was breath-tested after harbour staff noticed he `` smelled of alcohol '' as they helped dock the 40,000-tonne vessel shansi at marsden point north of auckland on friday .
he admitted breaching new zealand 's maritime law in whangarei district court on monday .
he has been fined 3,000 new zealand dollars ( us $ 2,222 ; £ 1,692 ) and suspended by his employer , the court heard .
author: Amy Gladwell, BBC News Online

documents.title: laser pen seized near exeter airport
text: night shift .
first job , youngsters shining lazer pen near houses and at security guards .
seized and warnings given as near air port .
do tell ?
we do with taser .
i suggest because it would lead the suspect to where the officer is secreted .
as a fmr laser engineer , it annoys me when people misuse these .
looking at the reflected beam some produce can be enough to cause blindness .
what happened to all the stuff you seize other then you sit there and play with it
idiots
is n't it a criminal offence to shine these laser pens at aircraft , ?
such dangerous behaviour !

documents.title: latest weather : staying cloudy with outbreaks of rain
text: it 'll continue a mostly cloudy day with outbreaks of patchy rain .
the rain may become heavy and also showery at times later , but there should also be some drier , and perhaps brighter interludes .
light or moderate southwesterly winds will turn to the northwest by the end of the day .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
tonight will remain largely cloudy with further outbreaks of rain .
winds will remain light or moderate from the northwest .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: torbay council halts hiv support suspension
text: torbay council has done a u-turn on plans to axe hiv support and advocacy services in the district .
the council had announced last month it would no longer fund the programme beyond the end of september .
the council had said torbay was `` not an area of high hiv prevalence '' and the money could be reinvested in wider preventative sexual health services .
the unitary authority said it had put the plans on hold and was doing more research to assess the impact of such a cut .
however , torbay 's liberal democrats said they feared it would be just a stay of execution for such services .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: travel : accident on a361 south molton
text: in south molton , there is slow moving traffic on a361 in both directions between aller cross and harpson lane due to an accident .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: plymouth model admits selling illegal weight-loss coffee
text: a former magazine model and miss england finalist has admitted selling illegal weight-loss coffee - and has shut down her company .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: search for missing retired guide dog
text: a big search has been carried out in south devon for a retired guide dog who 's been missing for more than three weeks .
the local community responded on sunday to an appeal on social media and dog lovers and their pets turned out to help look for 13-year-old indy in the anstey cove area .
more than 80 friends - human and canine - took part in the search .
owner helen redclift said : `` my cats and my dogs are my family .
i do hope he comes back soon . ''
author: Clare Woodling
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: a30 u-turns 'illegal and extremely dangerous '
text: police in cornwall are warning drivers that doing u-turns on the a30 near hayle is illegal and also `` extremely dangerous '' .

penzance police said on facebook that officers had recently `` received numerous reports '' of such manoeuvres and that drivers should be patient `` as we all know at this time of year there is grid lock and heavy traffic everywhere '' .
officers added : `` there were two serious collisions last year on the stretch between loggans and st erth , one resulting in the death of one driver .
`` our suggestion is to find an alternative route and , if not , wait patiently and you will get through . ''
police said regular patrols were being conducted and drivers caught performing u-turns `` will be stopped and dealt with accordingly '' .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: football : exeter city 1-0 cambridge united
text: last season 's league two play-off finalists exeter opened the new season at the weekend with a comfortable win against cambridge at st james ' park .
the only goal of an entertaining game came from reuben reid in the fifth minute after jordan moore-taylor 's long ball was needlessly handled inside the penalty box by jake carroll .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: passengers warned of waterloo station rail delays
text: people using britain 's busiest railway station are being warned to expect delays and cancelled trains as major work begins at waterloo station in london .
it means the closure of 10 platforms as work begins to extend them to accommodate longer trains .
more than 40,000 passengers from across the south of england use the station each day .
services run by south west trains , which operates routes to exeter , will be among those affected .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: travel : two-car crash in brixham
text: in brixham , on the a3022 , near laywell road , there has been an accident involving two cars .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: ship captain suspended for being over alcohol limit while berthing in new zealand
text: a cargo ship captain from devon has been suspended and fined for being five times over the legal alcohol limit while berthing his vessel in new zealand .
anthony michael baker , 53 , said he had n't been on duty but was called to the bridge when the crew reported problems .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: uk acid attack survivors call for tougher sentences
text: victims of acid attacks in britain are calling on the government to enforce longer prison sentences and tighten controls on the sale of corrosive substances , after a jump in the number of cases last year and in 2017 .
thirty-two-year-old andreas christopheros ( who was assaulted at his home in truro in 2014 , has joined this chorus of acid attack survivors demanding that tough words become reality .
`` i believe the uk has got its strategy towards this completely wrong , '' he told reuters at his home .

`` i strongly believe that the sentencing for anyone who carries out any form of acid attack , whether their intended victim is injured badly or not , should serve a life sentence , with a minimum term of 20 or more years . ''
the home office said it planned to set out guidance for prosecutors on classifying corrosive substances as dangerous weapons and to review sentencing guidelines .
author: Reuters

documents.title: 'no-one knows ' about homes and offices scheme for bodmin
text: the public consultation on cornwall council 's scheme on the county 's future is about to end and residents of a town are saying no-one knows about it and have not been consulted .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: two people arrested after man suffers 'life-threatening head injuries '
text: two people have been arrested after a man suffered potentially life-threatening head injuries in a suspected assault in cornwall .
police said the 27-year-old man was found injured in a car park in west street , st columb major , near newquay at about 22:10 last thursday .
he is being treated at a specialist head trauma hospital .
devon and cornwall police said : `` an investigation has commenced and police have arrested a 43-year-old man and 25-year-old woman on sus of assault to the injured male . ''
officers have appealed for anyone with information , or cctv of the area , or anyone that may have witnessed the incident to contact them .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: travel : accident in st budeaux , plymouth
text: in plymouth , in st budeaux there has been an accident on wolseley road near rennie avenue .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: 'too fat to work ' man campaigns against new fast food business in plymouth
text: a plymouth man who starred in the channel 5 reality television show benefits : too fat to work has launched a campaign against the latest plans for a fast food business opening in his area .
steve beer lives in st budeaux , where there are about 20 food outlets in the main shopping precinct and surrounding roads .
he said he was worried about an application by a pizza chain to take over a former bank site because the area `` does not need '' any more fast food businesses .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: abusive tombstoners 'intimidate tourists and threaten businesses '
text: police say they will crack down on groups of tombstoning youths who are intimidating tourists and businesses along the hoe waterfront .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'stolen ' van found 'near where driver thought he parked it '
text: called to van driver reporting van stolen at m5 services j30 .
i located it parked and secured near to where he 'thought ' he 'd parked it !
i think most of us have had the same initial panic
perhaps the `` thief '' returned it when he realised you were on the case
simply no other explanation !
did you check that he had n't had a cheeky beer or two ?
least an incident that was both quick & had a good outcome for all .
he was embarrassed and sober
i was joking .
poor guy sounds a bit like me when i lose my keys & one of the family point out where i 've left them .
i hope he got the coffees in
i bet we 've all done it .
he meant no harm and bet he was very red !
nooooooo
this must have been the sort of high octane stuff that got you in to policing in the first place
which is why they go on the pnc as los .
in the us , there is a service for such drivers .
it is called `` blondestar ''
ooer !
100 % recovery record .
well done

documents.title: latest weather : mostly cloudy with outbreaks of rain
text: after a cool start , it will be a mostly cloudy day with outbreaks of rain .
the rain may become heavy and also showery at times later , but there should be some drier interludes .
light or moderate southwesterly winds will turn to the northwest by the end of the day .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: arrests of children drop in devon
text: the number of children arrested in devon has dropped sharply .
the howard league for penal reform said devon and cornwall police arrested 994 children last year , down from just over 4,000 in 2010 .
across england and wales , the number of children arrested has dropped 64 % .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: 'significant species ' of marine life found at reef at the lizard
text: it 's claimed new evidence has emerged showing significant species of marine life at a nationally important reef , called the manacles , off the lizard .

developers who want to quarry stone near the reef have claimed there is little sign of any significant species , but a new report published for the marine conservation society said the area should be left undisturbed .
a volunteer diver organisation , called seasearch , also said it had found signs of a range of important marine life .
developers said that `` options for sea transport are still being investigated '' .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: disruption to south west trains because of waterloo works
text: rail travellers in the region are being warned of disruption to south west trains services to london for the rest of the month .
it 's because half of waterloo station is closed for the next three-and-a-half weeks while improvement work is carried out on 10 of its 22 platforms to make them longer .
many trains will be cancelled and most others reduced or altered , affecting some services to and from exeter .
the paddington line remains unaffected .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: parked cars affect fire engine call-out to vehicle 'arson '
text: the crew was called to a vehicle fire at about 01:20 in bodmin hill .
arson is suspected .
on route to the we had great difficulty get through parked cars on bodmin hill in @ twitterid this resulted in a slower attendance
and please can we use these photos too ?
thanks !

neighbour was banging on drivers door at 1.30am .
no answer
should ould have used your air jacks to push them asside , and charge them for your time !
ramming speed mr christian !
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: police investigate death of man in carclaze area
text: police in st austell are appealing for witnesses after the death of a man in the carclaze area at the weekend .
armed officers were called to ocean view just before 20:00 on saturday following the death of a man .
officers said the armed response was simply as a precaution and that , at this stage , the death was not being treated as sus and not the result of a criminal offence .
the man has not yet been formally identified and investigators appealed for anyone with information to come forward .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: rail disruption to and from london paddington
text: the south west 's penzance-london route - which also goes through plymouth , torbay and exeter - operates from paddington .
new : disruption to and from london paddington expected until 09:00 # londonpaddington
abysmal .
not the first time signal problems at hayes .
why are you and @ twitterid so incompetent you ca n't run a railway ?
hi nicholas .
apologies for the disruption .
where are you travelling to ?
lewis
paddington .
i will get the tube instead .
the suburban service is so unreliable it 's a joke .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: sus car fire damages two vehicles in torquay overnight
text: fire crews have been tackling a sus car fire in torquay overnight .
a number of people called 999 about the fire in shrewsbury avenue , watcombe , at about 02:50 where a car was described as well alight , devon and somerset fire and rescue service said .
another car parked close by was damaged by the heat .
it 's thought the blaze was started deliberately .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live
